testcase.name: runScenario["Successful addition of a new pet", "Add a New Pet to the Pet Store"](1)
testcase.system-out: Scenario Outline: Successful addition of a new pet # src/test/resources/features/Add a New Pet to the Pet Store.feature:10 Given I have the details of the pet "100","Tommy","available" # com.epam.ai.demo.stepdefinitions.PetStoreSteps.iHaveTheDetailsOfThePet(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Request spec is: io.restassured.internal.RequestSpecificationImpl@30501e60 Request method: POST Request URI: https://petstore.swagger.io/v2/pet Proxy: <none> Request params: <none> Query params: <none> Form params: <none> Path params: <none> Headers: Accept=*/* Content-Type=application/json Cookies: <none> Multiparts: <none> Body: { "id": 100, "name": "Tommy", "status": "available" } S Code: 200 When I send a POST request to the "pet" endpoint with the pet's details in JSON format # com.epam.ai.demo.stepdefinitions.PetStoreSteps.i_send_a_post_request_to_the_endpoint_with_the_pet_s_details_in_json_format(java.lang.String) Status code: 200 Body: {"id":100,"name":"Tommy","photoUrls":[],"tags":[],"status":"available"} Then the pet should be added to the store's inventory # com.epam.ai.demo.stepdefinitions.PetStoreSteps.the_pet_should_be_added_to_the_store_s_inventory()
testcase.system-err: SLF4J(W): No SLF4J providers were found. SLF4J(W): Defaulting to no-operation (NOP) logger implementation SLF4J(W): See https://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#noProviders for further details.

testcase.name: runScenario["Successful addition of a new pet", "Add a New Pet to the Pet Store"](2)
testcase.system-out: Scenario Outline: Successful addition of a new pet # src/test/resources/features/Add a New Pet to the Pet Store.feature:11 Given I have the details of the pet "200","Tommy200","available" # com.epam.ai.demo.stepdefinitions.PetStoreSteps.iHaveTheDetailsOfThePet(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Request spec is: io.restassured.internal.RequestSpecificationImpl@39de9bda Request method: POST Request URI: https://petstore.swagger.io/v2/pet Proxy: <none> Request params: <none> Query params: <none> Form params: <none> Path params: <none> Headers: Accept=*/* Content-Type=application/json Cookies: <none> Multiparts: <none> Body: { "id": 200, "name": "Tommy200", "status": "available" } S Code: 200 When I send a POST request to the "pet" endpoint with the pet's details in JSON format # com.epam.ai.demo.stepdefinitions.PetStoreSteps.i_send_a_post_request_to_the_endpoint_with_the_pet_s_details_in_json_format(java.lang.String) Status code: 200 Body: {"id":200,"name":"Tommy200","photoUrls":[],"tags":[],"status":"available"} Then the pet should be added to the store's inventory # com.epam.ai.demo.stepdefinitions.PetStoreSteps.the_pet_should_be_added_to_the_store_s_inventory()

testcase.name: runScenario["Verify that a pet can be retrieved by its ID", "Add a New Pet to the Pet Store"](3)
testcase.system-out: Scenario Outline: Verify that a pet can be retrieved by its ID # src/test/resources/features/Add a New Pet to the Pet Store.feature:21 Pet details: ID=300, Name=Tommy1, Status=available Given I have the details of the pet "300","Tommy1","available" exists # com.epam.ai.demo.stepdefinitions.PetStoreSteps.i_have_the_details_of_the_pet_exists(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Request spec is: io.restassured.internal.RequestSpecificationImpl@36790bec Request method: POST Request URI: https://petstore.swagger.io/v2/pet Proxy: <none> Request params: <none> Query params: <none> Form params: <none> Path params: <none> Headers: Accept=*/* Content-Type=application/json Cookies: <none> Multiparts: <none> Body: { "id": 300, "name": "Tommy1", "status": "available" } S Code: 200 When I send a POST request to the "pet" endpoint with the pet's details in JSON format # com.epam.ai.demo.stepdefinitions.PetStoreSteps.i_send_a_post_request_to_the_endpoint_with_the_pet_s_details_in_json_format(java.lang.String) Request method: GET Request URI: https://petstore.swagger.io/v2/pet/300 Proxy: <none> Request params: <none> Query params: <none> Form params: <none> Path params: <none> Headers: Accept=*/* Content-Type=application/json Cookies: <none> Multiparts: <none> Body: <none> Status Code: 200 When User retrieves the pet details with ID "300" # com.epam.ai.demo.stepdefinitions.PetStoreSteps.user_retrieves_the_pet_details_with_id(java.lang.String) Response Body: {"id":300,"name":"Tommy1","photoUrls":[],"tags":[],"status":"available"} Then The API should return a 200 OK response with the pet object that matches the "300","Tommy1","available" # com.epam.ai.demo.stepdefinitions.PetStoreSteps.the_api_should_return_a_200_ok_response_with_the_pet_object_that_matches(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String)
